title: Clearer homepage
body:
<!--Describe your proposed enhancement in detail.-->

Following up on https://twitter.com/lmeyerov/status/1453172189423800323 , I hadn't realized dirty_cat 's `SuperVectorizer()` automates feature encoding despite having seen the site a couple times

Thoughts:

Homepage: 
- [ ] `Automatically ingest a heterogeneous dataframe` => `Automatically generate many features from any dataframe`
"""
SuperVectorizer: a simple transformer to easily turn a non-normalized pandas dataframe into a numpy array for machine learning
"""
=>
"""
SuperVectorizer: An automatic transformer that turns arbitrary pandas dataframes into a numpy array for machine learning and recommends a feature encoding pipeline you can tweak
"""
- [ ] `OneHotEncoder but for non-normalized categories` => 
"""
Guide individual vectorizers for many datatypes:
Beyond fully-automatic generation, you can also work with individual vectorizers and tune their piplines:
* Pipeline() - mix automatic & manual strategies
* OneHot() - ...
"""
- [ ] API Documentation table: move `SuperVectorizer` to the first, and use color to highlight it is unlike the regular manual vectorizers
- [ ] Github readme.md: put supervectorizer() first and as a conceptually separate thing from individual vectorizers




<!--List any pages that would be impacted by the enhancement.-->
### Affected pages

readme.md

https://dirty-cat.github.io/stable/index.html
